page.title: 08ST PHILIP HOWARD HIGH SCHOOL
page.content: In 1985 the St Philip Howard Catholic High School started its 26th year. The school opened on 9th September, 1959 as a secondary modern school with 214 pupils. By 1970 the school became a comprehensive taking pupils from 11 to 18. By 1985 the school had expanded to take 740 pupils. In 1985 a Â£500,000 extension was completed. The first head was Mr Lionel Short who retired in 1976. The present headmaster is Mr Vincent Kelly. The school was named after St Philip Howard, Earl of Arundel. The school playing fields extend for 11 acres.The pupils who attend the school come from West Sussex, Midhurst in the north, Southbourne in the west, Angmering in the east and Selsey in the south.The school was built in Barnham due to the good rail services in 1959. By Louise Finkle
